body: @promag thank you for the review. I added the changes and will include the tests and release note soon.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16365](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16365.html) (Log RPC parameters (arguments) if -debug=rpcparams by LarryRuane)
* [#16199](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16199.html) (rpc: fix showing wrong amount when not all inputs are from me in gettransaction by shannon1916)
* [#14707](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14707.html) ([RPC] Include coinbase transactions in receivedby RPCs by andrewtoth)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> Concept ACK, please include tests and a release note.

Since there was no functional test for the `gettransaction` I created a new one. However it only tests the `decoded` field since I don't know if testing other would not be overkill.
Maybe add the test in test/functional/wallet_basic.py instead?
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3

body:
You can use named arguments and drop the comment above (untested):
```py
tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid=txid, decode=True)
```
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2019 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test gettransaction RPC command"""
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import assert_equal
+
+class GetTransactionTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
+        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.test_gettransaction_decoding()
+    
+    def test_gettransaction_decoding(self):
+        self.log.info("Testing gettransaction decoding...")
+        self.nodes[0].generate(101)
+        txid = self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
+        #Â False for 'include_watchonly', True for 'decode'
+        tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid, False, True)

```diff
+tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid, decode=True)['decoded']
```

body:
Sorry for the post-merge review comment, but would it make sense to call the new parameter `verbose`, to mirror the `verbose` argument in `getrawtransaction`?

If so, we should make that change before v0.19 to avoid an API change.

> Sorry for the post-merge review comment, but would it make sense to call the new parameter `verbose`, to mirror the `verbose` argument in `getrawtransaction`?
> 
> If so, we should make that change before v0.19 to avoid an API change.

This seems like a good idea. You could open a one-line PR and add the milestone to get more feedback.
+1 for API consistency.
